title: Big Plays Spotlight: The Wrath of Zed

replies.body:
Holy shit its me. Oh and I'm not plat 2 anymore I'm d5!

EDIT: To everyone who added me to tell me about the play, it is so amazing to see the support and compliments from you guys. I am sure all of you guys can do the same play I made, just have to be in the right spot at the right time! I am no different than anyone of you guys, just a regular guy who Riot noticed. Appreciate all the love!
Hi! We'll update that! :) Congrats on Diamond (and the awesome play)!
thx a lot ^_^. Went home sick from work and a friend texts me saying that you guys posted my play... what a way to make me feel better!
Awwww so glad we could make you feel better! <3 Get better soon so you can get back to making big plays.
Awh it's one thing when you love a game, it's another when your game loves you back. Riot <3
rito please why u dont guys give ppl 1 refund per season or 100 RP if u win 10 in a row in ranked like some achivements ?
I think they should bring back the 3 refunds because I bought all the things I refunded XD.Should be 3 per season but no RP or achievements, could bring a more toxic community

> I think they should bring back the 3 refunds because I bought all the things I refunded XD.Should be 3 per season but no RP or achievements, could bring a more toxic community

This.
Awesome play mate. Congrats on Diamond and the feature!
Those were some pretty sick moves! Congrats on D5 and good luck with your continued climb on the fields of justice!
{{item:3073}} Reporting dreamskape for crushing the hopes and dreams of players with his OP plays.  {{item:3073}}
Ya, players like me {{item:3070}}
Best comment I've seen yet.
Faker 2.0. Sweet Jesus that was sick. Congratulations for D5 and grats in advance for reaching Challenger :P
I saw u post this on reddit a while back, nice!
Can I have your Autograph ?
that was a sick play dude, nj
It's the casual walking away during the final kill that really does it. lol
Finally a comment worth reading!!! I didn't even have to play Pictionary!

Senpai is that you?

Teach me how to Faker, Senpai!

I'm really tired of people using the word "Senpai". It practically means **Senior **or **Elder** in **Japanese**. But, since Faker is fucking Korean and not Japanese (lawl), he is refereed to as **Sunbae**.
So, please reconsider next time.

It's an extension of the joke: "Senpai notice me"
Not so much a matter of cultural ignorance so much as it is referencing a joke which happens to have its roots in Japanese. So, please, relax a bit

To clarify it is not really a joke.  Japanese is very literal.  It is a request for attention from the teacher or master.  It does not mean Senior or Elder other than in general hierarchy of the culture and language.  Translated in the context of English it is simply a replacement for the word teacher.

I'm pretty sure its just a joke. Also Senpai is for seniority, something like a mentor. You wouldn't call your teacher senpai you would call them sensei.

The more you know {{champion:161}}
I'm of mind with Akemi on this one.  If you're going to do a cultural ~~stereotype~~ 'joke', at least do it right.
Obviously Twitch is playing with shadows turned off. That's why he got hit by that last E.

{{champion:238}} Almost as if there were 2 of him{{champion:238}} 

Can't beat the twin shadows{{item:3023}}
{{champion:11}} + {{champion:157}} = {{champion:24}}
I can't see the meaning behind these equations. {{champion:64}}
Upon further analysis I concluded that you, in fact, cannot see anything. {{champion:161}}
{{champion:105}} +{{summoner:14}} = Fishsticks

I find the best part is that Zed wasn't ahead at all at that point.

Too many people say that getting a penta when you have 20 kills already is "skillful". Don't get me wrong, your execution may be flawless, but that would've never happened had you not been so ridicolously fed beforehand.

Because picking up 20 kills is easy, and the fact that you're good enough to take over a game yourself means that the pentakill you finish it with is worthless.

#logic.

For the record, Zed's team was actually up about 5-6k gold due to dragons, a tower, and general cs betterness, as well as a couple kills which happened to be on Zed.  He was ahead of Fizz and Twitch by a substantial amount.  That said, 2v1ing even from a big lead is impressive, and the style with which those kills were executed as well as the fact that he effecively fought two separate duels makes that play incredibly impressive IMO, regardless of how ahead he might or might not have been.

Welcome, esportsfans, to another exciting episode of Big Plays Spotlight, where we feature high mobility champions wrecking hapless low mobility champions.  This week we have Zed, the high-mobility assassin!

Mobile champions do lend themselves to flashy plays, but I think it detrimental that these champions often outclass their low mobility counterparts.

(props to the Zed, a very well executed play)

Fizz

jumps over wall

> low mobility

what
Well I may go ham sometimes, but this guy goes korean.
And then the YouTube comments all talking about how crap this play is and how they do that everyday... sigh

(Enemy Team)
{{champion:29}} Hey Fizz want blue?
{{champion:105}} Oh Thnx man. U da best!
{{champion:238}} **DOUBLE KILL!**
{{champion:105}} I hate u Twitch...
Um...why does enemy team have {{champion:236}} and {{champion:29}} on the same team? lol I mean it's a cool double kill, don't get me wrong, but...that team comp is pretty lousy.
Jungle twitch
Twitch is jungling, it seems. You can see the {{item:3209}} in his rightmost item slot.
He also has smite.
It's plays like these that make me think "Hahahaha...Oh Zed, why did I ever buy you?" because it's going to be YEARS before I'm ever even close to being that good.
i love how he starts the fight fighting fizz then sees twitch shooting at him and is like "nah bro"
i like how twitch WALKED into the shadow slash at the end pretty much XD

He didn't "Walk" exactly he was trying to kite him but right clicked a second after zed ported out so he hit the ground, basically he just messed up the kite attempt.
That said it was still hilarious XD

I main Zed{{champion:238}}  and enjoy the combos that he can accomplish (without perfect timing from a Zhonya's{{item:3157}} , too much crowd control{{summoner:1}}{{item:3111}} {{item:3139}}  , and a counter ult of course{{champion:23}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:127}} {{champion:90}} ) to take down an enemy.

I've been trying to stray away from any mainstream builds with him, mostly to keep the enemy guessing, but also to try to reach a new plateau with a ninja.

I'm asking the Zed users in the community, if you get fed, to try out Infinity Edge{{item:3031}}  and Sword of the Divine{{item:3131}}  mixed together in a build of your own.  Read the active on Sword of the Divine and how effective it can be (can even combo down a tanky Xin Zhao{{champion:5}} , or Lee Sin{{champion:64}} , for a kill) once properly used in a combo.
Redmercy made a video talking about a build like this. I think you should watch it its called duelist zed.

I thinks its ridiculous that all the comments on YouTube are basically "ooh I could do this" or "this is lame".  i hate some of the YouTube community because of shit like that. (sorry rant). the only thing that would make this better is either an epic explosion behind zed or the "deal with it" sunglasses falling onto zed. awesome play man.
